function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Variability in testing techniques and accuracy of results","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Rapid increase in demand for testing kits","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of ai and ml in predicting infection spreading rates and diagnosing diseases","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relying solely on online information from verified sources may lead to incomplete or biased understanding of the pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Elimination of works that may contain relevant information may result in oversight of key insights or developments in pandemic control","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential bias in the selection and scrutiny of works may result in a skewed representation of the available information","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases due to lack of effective technological measures","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate adoption of remote working and distance learning technologies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Investigation of various implemented technologies and their influence in controlling the pandemic.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Ineffective use of masks and lack of knowledge on mask usage","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Failure to adhere to social distancing and isolation measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited control over infection spread despite combined efforts","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of effective treatment and vaccine","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient public adherence to preventive measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of understanding of disease agent life cycles in urban settings","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of water feature design in urban areas","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Unsuitable selection of tree species in highly populated areas","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Introduction or reestablishment of new species in urban areas fostering the transmission of vector-borne and zoonotic diseases","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Designing water features in a way that limits mosquito breeding and algal growth, but increases the danger for children and pets","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Maintaining undisturbed vegetation around a pond providing habitat for rats and other rodents","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Introduction of exotic species causing new allergies among urban residents","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High levels of air pollutants in urban areas","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mechanical interaction between air pollutants and pollen grains","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High allergenicity of ornamental plant pollen","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Overabundance of specific plant species in urban vegetation","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited dispersion of pollen due to road-side tree planting","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased pollen exposure due to urban green space","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Rising prevalence and severity of pollinosis","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Impact of climate change and air pollution on pollinosis exposure","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Excess algal growth in urban bodies of water","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risks associated with rodent habitat near ponds due to undisturbed vegetation","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Health risks associated with water toxins and algal blooms","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Algal blooms may produce phytotoxins and hepatotoxins, leading to water contamination and health risks for humans and animals.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Neurotoxins produced by algal blooms can affect the nervous system of exposed organisms, leading to severe health effects and potential fatality.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Algal blooms in urban ponds may pose less of a threat to humans, but still require monitoring and management to prevent any potential risks.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased overgrowth of aquatic vegetation leading to low dissolved oxygen levels and stagnant water areas","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Excessive growth of algae and cyanobacteria in urban ponds","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Poorly designed landscape details contributing to production of troublesome numbers of mosquitoes","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of natural predators in constructed bodies of water leading to increased mosquito populations","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High conductivity and low dissolved oxygen content in water leading to higher mosquito larval densities","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Constructed wet environments are the predominant producers of mosquitoes in urban areas","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Urban wetlands and water bodies provide suitable habitat for bird species, increasing the possibility of disease transmission to human populations","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Stagnant, shallow water is associated with high mosquito larvae counts in constructed wet environments","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Urban water bodies and wetlands providing habitats for mosquitoes","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High mosquito densities in constructed wet environments","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inefficient rodent control measures leading to increased rat populations","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate design and management of urban green spaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Introduction of open surface water in urban design","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increasing connectivity between green areas in modern cities could facilitate the spread of infectious diseases between geographically distant rat populations.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"The increase in biodiversity of rodent predators may foster the introduction of certain pathogens into urban landscapes.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"}]}
